Package wt.access.agreement

The agreement service is responsible for managing authorization agreements that, for a defined period of time, make an exception to restrictions put in place by security label values on specified Windchill SecurityLabeled objects.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    AgreementService
    AgreementService provides client-invokable methods to agreement services.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AgreementAttributes
    AgreementAttributes provides a place to specify the agreement attributes necessary for creating a new AuthorizationAgreement object.
    AgreementAuthorizedObject
    This class represents a SecurityLabeled object that the AuthorizationAgreement covers.
    AgreementConstants
    Constants used in client and server for Agreements

    Supported API: true
    AgreementHelper
    Helper class that provides easy access to the implementation of methods defined by the AgreementService interface.
    AgreementsDelegateFactory
    A factory to get agreements delegates that could be supplied with out of the box Windchill or customized by a customer.
    AuthorizationAgreement
    This object represents a particular iteration of an authorization agreement.

Package wt.access.agreement Description

The agreement service is responsible for managing authorization agreements that, for a defined period of time, make an exception to restrictions put in place by security label values on specified Windchill SecurityLabeled objects.

 

Design Overview

Authorization agreements are Typed, RevisionControlled objects that can make an exception to a security label value restriction on a specific set of SecurityLabeled objects for a specific set of principals for a specific period of time. In the higher-level context of security labels, each security label value can be associated with an agreement type that identifies which agreements make an exception to an access restriction if the security label value itself normally restricts access. When evaluating security labels (see the wt.access package), if the security label value restricts access to an object for a user, and there is an agreement type associated with that label value, an agreement service API can be invoked that will search for active agreements of that type that will make the exception to the restriction for that user and object. If any active agreement is found matching those criteria, the user is considered �cleared� for that security label. Note that discretionary access control still applies even if a user is �cleared� for all security labels applied to a SecurityLabeled object.

Authorization Agreement Object Model

 

SecurityLabeled objects that are associated with an agreement are represented by the AgreementItem interface. There are two concrete implementations of that interface; AgreementAuthorizedObject and AgreementAuthorizedProxy. AgreementAuthorizedObject represents objects that implement the SecurityLabeled interface that still exist in the Windchill database. For objects that no longer exist in the Windchill database, the external display identifier of that object is retrieved at the time of delete and is stored in an AgreementAuthorizedProxy object in the default system locale. Because the access policies of the original SecurityLabeled object were lost when it was deleted, AgreementAuthorizedProxy objects are PolicyAccessControlled so that access policies can be written for them to control who can access the external display identifiers after the delete.

 

AgreementItem Object Model

 

External Interface

The functionality of this service is represented by the AgreementService (accessible through the AgreementHelper), and the AgreementServiceSvr (accessible through the AgreementServerHelper).

StandardAgreementService handles agreement creation, deletion, querying, enforcement, and other associated actions.

 

Business Rules

The rule for agreement enforcement returns true (user is authorized) if an authorization agreement is found that matches all of the following criteria. Otherwise, false is returned.

� The security label value must be associated with an agreement type and the agreement must be that type or a child type. If a security label value is not associated with an agreement type, no agreement can grant access for that security label value.

� The agreement must be in the defined �approved� lifecycle state (which is configurable).

� The agreement must be active; meaning the current date/time must be within the range of the agreement�s start date and end date.

� The object must exist in the same container as the agreement or in a child container.

� The object must be one of the SecurityLabeled objects associated with the agreement. This means for Versioned objects, the object�s branch must be associated with the agreement (i.e., the agreement applies to all iterations of a version); for Iterated objects, the object�s Master must be associated with the agreement (i.e., the agreement applies to all iterations of the object); for all other objects, the object must be associated with the agreement.

� The principal or one of its parent groups must be one of the principals associated with the agreement.

 

Event Processing

The agreement service does not emit any events. It listens for the following events:
